intro: Ruellia haughtii, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ruellia haughtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
